title: Update roadmap for Q1
description: Update the Q1 roadmap to reflect that onboarding revamp is now the top priority and the advanced analytics pilot should be pushed to March.
evidence: Mira, please update the roadmap to reflect that, and push analytics pilot to March?

title: Define 3 concrete KPIs for onboarding success
description: Identify and propose 3 specific Key Performance Indicators to measure the success of the onboarding process, aiming for metrics that can be measured within 30 days.
evidence: Mira, I want 3 concrete KPIs to measure onboarding success within 30 days. Can you do that by tomorrow morning?

title: Plan lightweight usability tests for new onboarding prototype
description: Organize a small-scale usability test (maximum two sessions) once the new onboarding prototype is ready.
deadline: After new onboarding prototype is ready
evidence: Leah: Should we plan a quick usability test after the new onboarding prototype is ready? Nothing big, like two sessions max? Jeffy: Sounds good. Keep it lightweight.

title: Complete backend changes for onboarding
description: Engineering team to finalize backend modifications required for the new onboarding flow.
evidence: Arun: Engineering can do backend changes this week...

title: Complete UI changes for onboarding
description: Engineering team to finalize UI modifications required for the new onboarding flow.
evidence: ...and UI next week.

title: Prepare for internal onboarding demo
description: Engineering team to prepare the core onboarding flow, with backend integrated and UI mostly done, for an internal demonstration.
evidence: We're aiming for a Thursday internal demo.

title: Ensure consistent internal messaging regarding onboarding launch
description: Communicate internally that the onboarding update will be a silent launch without external marketing, and maintain consistent messaging.
evidence: Jeffy: Silent. No ads or blog posts. Leah: I'll keep messaging consistent.

title: Deliver design assets for onboarding
description: Provide the necessary design assets to Arun's engineering team for the onboarding development.
evidence: Arun: Waiting on design assets tonight. Leah: You'll have them by 8 PM.

title: Instrument detailed funnel tracking for onboarding
description: Implement detailed tracking mechanisms to identify specific drop-off points within the user onboarding funnel.
evidence: Jeffy: What about drop-off points? Mira: We'll instrument detailed funnel tracking to spot where users leave.

title: Implement A/B test for deferring onboarding permissions
description: Develop and set up an A/B test variant for the onboarding flow that defers certain permission requests to a later stage to reduce friction.
evidence: Mira: That could reduce friction. Should we test that variant? Jeffy: Yes, put that in as an A/B test post-launch.

title: Design explanatory microcopy and tooltips for permission screen
description: Create additional microcopy and short tooltips to clarify the necessity of upfront permissions on the onboarding screen, addressing user confusion.
evidence: Jeffy: Could we add more explanatory microcopy? Daniel: ...adding short tooltips could help here. Jeffy: Sounds good, Daniel. Can you work on that?

title: Record usability test sessions
description: Ensure all planned usability testing sessions for onboarding are recorded for later analysis.
evidence: Jeffy: Excellent. Make sure to record sessions for analysis. Leah: Already planned.

title: Draft internal messaging regarding analytics pilot delay
description: Prepare communication for internal teams to manage expectations about the advanced analytics pilot being pushed to March.
evidence: Mira: ...analytics pilot push might disappoint marketing. Jeffy: ...Leah, please help draft messaging to internal teams.

title: Fix data pipeline bugs for analytics
description: Utilize the extra time gained from delaying the analytics pilot to identify and resolve bugs in the data pipeline to improve data accuracy.
evidence: Arun: ...can we use this time to improve data accuracy? Jeffy: Absolutely. Use the extra time to fix data pipeline bugs.

title: Create a deck summarizing roadmap update
description: Prepare a concise presentation deck outlining the key changes and dates for the updated Q1 roadmap.
evidence: Mira: For the roadmap update, do you want a formal doc or just a quick deck? Jeffy: Deck with key changes and dates. Keep it tight.

title: Prepare to field questions for onboarding demo
description: Mira, representing Product, should be ready to answer questions during the internal onboarding demo on Thursday.
evidence: Mira: Will product be ready to field questions? Jeffy: Yes, Mira, you should be prepped.

title: Prepare user feedback snippets for onboarding demo
description: Compile and prepare quick user feedback snippets to present during the internal onboarding demo.
evidence: Leah: I can prepare quick user feedback snippets for the demo. Jeffy: Perfect.

title: Collating, prioritizing, and updating sprint backlog based on demo feedback
description: Gather feedback from the internal demo, prioritize action items, and update the sprint backlog accordingly.
evidence: Jeffy: Demo feedback gets collated, prioritized, and sprint backlog updated.

title: Invite Customer Success team to onboarding demo
description: Extend an invitation to the Customer Success team to attend the internal onboarding demo.
evidence: Leah: Should we invite customer success team? Jeffy: Yeah, good idea.

title: Conduct smoke tests for onboarding
description: The QA team is to perform smoke tests on the onboarding flow.
evidence: Arun: QA is prepping test cases for onboarding. Will do smoke tests by Wednesday.

title: Finish final icons for design assets
description: Complete the remaining icon designs needed for the onboarding project, which is currently a blocker.
evidence: Daniel: Yep, finishing final icons today.

title: Review final design icons
description: Review the final icon designs completed by Daniel.
evidence: Leah: I'll review those tomorrow morning.

title: Add 'ease of use' rating to post-onboarding survey
description: Incorporate a qualitative 'ease of use' rating question into the survey distributed to users after onboarding.
evidence: Mira: For KPIs, we might want to add qualitative feedback, like “ease of use” rating. Jeffy: Good call. Leah: We'll add that to post-onboarding survey.

title: Push for design intern recruitment
description: Advocate for and initiate the process to bring in a design intern to alleviate the current resource crunch in the design team.
evidence: Jeffy: Can we get an intern in design? Mira: I’ll push for it.

title: Speed up design intern hiring process
description: Expedite the recruitment and hiring process for the design intern, leveraging existing candidates from HR.
evidence: Leah: HR said they have candidates lined up. Jeffy: Cool, please speed that up.

title: Build onboarding as modular pieces
description: Develop the onboarding flow using a modular architecture to allow for easier future iterations and avoid extensive rewrites.
evidence: Mira: ...do we want to build onboarding as modular pieces for future iterations? Jeffy: Worth it. Build modular to avoid rewrites later.

title: Design clearer error messages for onboarding
description: Develop improved designs for error messages within the onboarding flow based on user feedback.
evidence: Jeffy: Definitely a must. Daniel: Will work on error message designs next week.

title: Send weekly email updates to Marketing on onboarding progress
description: Provide regular weekly email updates to the Marketing team regarding the progress of the onboarding project.
evidence: Mira: Marketing still wants early heads-up on onboarding progress. Jeffy: Weekly email updates to them.

title: Coordinate compliance check for analytics data retention policy
description: Initiate and manage a compliance review with the legal team regarding the data retention policy for advanced analytics.
evidence: Arun: Need to clarify analytics data retention policy. Jeffy: Compliance check with legal. Mira: I’ll coordinate.

title: Add internationalization adjustments for visuals to backlog
description: Place the task of adjusting visuals for potential future internationalization support into the product backlog.
evidence: Daniel: Visuals might need adjustments for internationalization. Jeffy: Keep that in backlog.

title: Update onboarding help pages
description: Revise and update the existing help documentation related to user onboarding.
evidence: Mira: Regarding user support, is there a help doc update planned? Leah: Yes, updating onboarding help pages this week.
